locations.name: Dorm Room
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 1
Your dorm room. Messy desk. Clock ticking.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 1
You’re in your dorm room—the one place that still feels safe. The desk is a landfill of
printouts, crumbs, and scribbled pseudocode. Your editor is open, PythonTA errors lurking like
landmines. This is the drop-off point: bring the missing essentials here before the deadline.

Exits: south (to King's College Road), west (to Dorm Hallway).

locations.name: Dorm Hallway
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 2
A quiet hallway outside your room.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 2
The dorm hallway is dim and oddly still, like everyone vanished mid-semester. A vending
machine hums with the confidence of a corporate villain. Someone left a few flyers on the floor,
trampled and unread.

Exits: east (back to Dorm Room), west (to Residence Lobby).

locations.name: Residence Lobby
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 3
The residence lobby warm lights, cold air outside.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 3
The lobby smells faintly like microwaved noodles and winter coats. A front desk sits empty,
with a little bell that feels illegal to ring. Through the glass you can see campus paths stretching
out like a maze.

Exits: east (to Dorm Hallway), west (toward Convocation Hall).

locations.name: Front Campus Path
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 4
A wide stone path across front campus.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 4
Front Campus is open and winter-bright, the kind of cold that makes your thoughts sharper and
your fingers slower. Your shoes scrape over stone. Somewhere nearby, a door slams and echoes.

Exits: east (toward Residence Lobby), west (to Convocation Steps).

locations.name: Convocation Steps
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 5
Quiet steps outside Convocation Hall.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 5
The steps outside Convocation Hall are empty—no tours, no photos, no chaos. Just you, a big
stone building, and the feeling that you’re forgetting something important. Wind funnels through
the space like it’s trying to hurry you.

Exits: east (back to Front Campus Path).

locations.name: Hart House Circle
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 6
A calm circle near Hart House.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 6
Hart House sits like a stone promise—quiet, serious, and slightly intimidating. A few footprints
cut across the snow like someone sprinted through with purpose. This spot feels like a junction,
a place where routes split and decisions matter.

Exits: north (to St. George Street Gate), south (to Residence Lobby hallway-path).

locations.name: St. George Street Gate
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 7
Campus edge: traffic, wind, and the city.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 7
Here the campus loosens its grip and Toronto rushes in. Cars hiss on wet pavement. A gust of
wind yanks at your sleeves like it’s personally offended by your schedule.

Exits: south (to Hart House Circle), east (to Queen's Park Edge).

locations.name: Queen's Park Edge
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 8
Trees, iron fences, and quiet air.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 8
The edge of Queen’s Park is quieter than it should be. Trees stand like dark pillars. A squirrel
watches you with the suspicion of a TA during office hours.

Exits: west (back to St. George Street Gate).

locations.name: King's College Road
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 9
A campus road with footsteps and bike tracks.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 9
King’s College Road is a long corridor of movement—footsteps, bike tracks, and the occasional
student power-walking like they’re late for their entire life.

Exits: north (to Dorm Room), east (to Robarts Plaza).

locations.name: Robarts Plaza
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 10
Robarts ahead—concrete and confidence.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 10
Robarts rises in front of you like a brutalist spaceship. Students slip in and out like it’s a portal.
You can almost feel the weight of deadlines in the air.

Exits: west (to King's College Road), east (to Robarts Entrance).

locations.name: Robarts Entrance
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 11
Warm air, security gates, and hushed voices.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 11
The entrance is a threshold: outside stress becomes inside stress, just quieter. The gates beep
at someone nearby. A sign asks for silence with the authority of a final exam.

Exits: west (to Robarts Plaza), east (to Robarts Study Hall), north (to Sid Smith Hallway).

locations.name: Robarts Quiet Study
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 12
Silent study—every sound feels illegal.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 12
It’s so quiet you can hear your own thoughts compiling. A student nearby has three monitors
and the calm of someone who definitely backed up their files.

Exits: west (to Robarts Entrance).

locations.name: Sid Smith Hallway
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 13
A hallway with classroom doors and old posters.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 13
Sid Smith hallways feel like a conveyor belt for first-year panic. Posters advertise clubs you
swore you’d join. Someone’s abandoned a coffee cup on a ledge like a warning.

Exits: south (to Robarts Entrance), north (to Sid Smith Lobby).

locations.name: Sid Smith Lobby
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 14
Open lobby; stairs and echoes.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 14
The lobby is brighter than the hallways, with echoes that make every footstep dramatic.
There’s a screen showing upcoming talks you don’t have time for.

Exits: south (to Sid Smith Hallway), east (to Philosopher's Walk North).

locations.name: Museum Lawn
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 15
A cold open lawn near the museum.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 15
The museum lawn is wide and exposed. The city feels close here, like campus is just borrowing
a corner of Toronto for a while. Your breath fogs up your vision for a second—then clears.

Exits: south (to Philosopher's Walk North).

locations.name: Philosopher's Walk North
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 16
A tree-lined path, quieter than the roads.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 16
Philosopher’s Walk is calmer than everything else. Trees lean over the path like they’re trying
to hear your plan. It’s a good place to think—dangerous, because thinking wastes moves.

Exits: west (to Sid Smith Lobby), east (to Varsity Gate), north (to Museum Lawn).

locations.name: Varsity Gate
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 17
A gate near Varsity fields—windy and open.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 17
The Varsity gate opens onto open space. The wind hits harder here. The field looks empty,
like it’s waiting for a game that never starts.

Exits: west (to Philosopher's Walk North), south (to Bahen Side Entrance).

locations.name: Bahen Side Entrance
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 18
Bahen nearby—glass, light, and late-night energy.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 18
Even from the side, Bahen glows. You can almost hear keyboards and quiet despair behind the
glass. Someone taped a meme to the doorframe. It’s old, but still accurate.

Exits: north (to Varsity Gate), east (to Bahen Main Doors).

locations.name: Bahen Main Doors
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 19
Main doors, big atrium feel.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 19
The main doors feel like entering a different world: brighter, warmer, and full of people who
look like they forgot what sleep is. A security guard glances up, then back down.

Exits: west (to Bahen Side Entrance), south (to Bahen 1F).

locations.name: Bahen 1F
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 20
Tables, outlets, and quiet concentration.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 20
The first floor is a sea of tables and charging cables. Someone has a mechanical keyboard
that sounds like it’s trying to start a war. You spot a familiar-looking charger brick… maybe.

Exits: north (to Bahen Main Doors), east (to Bahen 2F Labs).

locations.name: Bahen 2F Labs
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 21
Lab machines and the glow of monitors.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 21
Rows of lab computers sit like an army. The fans whisper. A whiteboard is filled with half a
proof and a doodle of a dragon. Classic.

Exits: west (to Bahen 1F), south (to Bookstore Back Door).

locations.name: College Street Corner
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 22
Street corner—cars, crosswalks, and rush.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 22
The street corner is loud. You wait for the light and bounce on your heels. Someone’s dropped
a pencil near the curb, like a tiny offering to the semester.

Exits: west (to Gerstein Lane), south (to St. Mike's Alley).

locations.name: Gerstein Lane
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 23
A narrow lane beside Gerstein.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 23
A narrow lane funnels you between buildings. The air smells like cold stone and old books.
This feels like a place where lost items end up when nobody’s looking.

Exits: east (to College Street Corner), west (to Gerstein Entrance).

locations.name: Gerstein Entrance
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 24
Quiet library doors and medical posters.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 24
Gerstein’s entrance is calmer than you expect. Posters for health workshops line the walls.
Inside, you can see students who look like they’ve been awake since 2019.

Exits: east (to Gerstein Lane).

locations.name: Bookstore Back Door
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 25
Back entrance—deliveries and stacked boxes.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 25
Behind the bookstore, boxes are stacked like a poorly balanced Jenga tower. A receipt printer
chirps somewhere inside. If you needed paper, pens, or a miracle—this is where you’d find it.

Exits: north (to Bahen 2F Labs).

locations.name: St. Mike's Alley
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 26
A tucked-away alley, quiet and cold.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 26
This alley is the kind of place you never notice until you’re late and desperate. Snow piles up
in corners. Your footsteps sound too loud.

Exits: north (to College Street Corner), east (to Cafe Alley).

locations.name: Cafe Alley
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 27
Smell of coffee leaking through a side door.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 27
The smell is unfairly good. A side door is propped open with a wedge, and warm air spills out
like a trap designed to steal your time.

Exits: west (to St. Mike's Alley), east (to Student Commons).

locations.name: Student Commons
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 28
Couches, chatter, and exhausted faces.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 28
People are slumped on couches like they’ve been defeated by midterms. Someone laughs too
loudly. Someone else stares into their laptop like it’s a portal.

Exits: west (to Cafe Alley), east (to Help Desk Nook).

locations.name: Print Lab
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 29
Printers, paper trays, and toner smell.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 29
The print lab feels like a production line for deadlines. A printer jams, someone sighs, and the
world continues. A label maker sits on a table like it has authority.

Exits: west (to Help Desk Nook).

locations.name: Help Desk Nook
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 30
A tiny counter, a bell, and too many forms.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 30
A tiny help desk nook with a bell you definitely shouldn’t ring. A stack of forms sits neatly,
like paperwork is a hobby. Someone left a calculator here—probably by accident, probably not.

Exits: west (to Student Commons), east (to Print Lab).

locations.name: Underground Tunnel
locations.brief_description:
LOCATION 31
A narrow underground tunnel beneath campus.
locations.long_description:
LOCATION 31
The tunnel is low and concrete-lined, lit by flickering fluorescent lights that hum just loudly
 enough to be unsettling. Old pipes run along the ceiling, wrapped in peeling insulation. This
 feels like infrastructure students were never meant to see—just a forgotten artery beneath
 campus, connecting places without asking permission.

Exits: west (to Robarts Entrance), east (to Print Lab).

items.name: usb drive
items.description: Your only copy of the project. Losing this is instant tragedy.
items.hint: Where you started, where the code lives, where the deadline waits.
items.completion_text: You plug the USB in. The files are there. For the first time today, you breathe.

items.name: laptop charger
items.description: A familiar charger brick. Your battery is not going to survive without it.
items.hint: Power belongs near the desk that refuses to sleep.
items.completion_text: The charging light flicks on. Time just became negotiable again.

items.name: lucky mug
items.description: The mug that carried you through every late night. You refuse to submit without it.
items.hint: It belongs where coffee turns panic into progress.
items.completion_text: You set the mug down carefully. Superstition satisfied.

items.name: student card
items.description: Your UofT student card. You feel naked without it.
items.hint: You always leave it where you feel most like yourself.
items.completion_text: You slide the card onto your desk. Identity restored.

items.name: stapler
items.description: A small stapler. Weirdly comforting.
items.hint: Paperwork tends to pile up where ink and printers collide.
items.completion_text: You add it to the supply pile. Organization increases by 1.

items.name: campus map
items.description: A folded campus map with coffee stains and frantic circles.
items.hint: Once you’re home, you won’t need this anymore.
items.completion_text: You flatten the map out, then shove it into a drawer. Done with wandering.

items.name: gym pass
items.description: A gym pass card. The universe is insisting you do cardio today.
items.hint: Its purpose is fulfilled exactly where it was issued.
items.completion_text: You nod at the gym like you’ll be back. Maybe.

items.name: bus ticket
items.description: An unpunched TTC transfer. It might still be valid… maybe.
items.hint: Transportation worries end where you sleep.
items.completion_text: You toss the ticket aside. You’re not going anywhere now.

items.name: umbrella
items.description: A battered umbrella that still pretends it works.
items.hint: Shelter first. Weather later.
items.completion_text: You lean it by the door. It drips quietly, defeated.

items.name: protein bar
items.description: Emergency calories. Tastes like cardboard. Still worth it.
items.hint: Food belongs wherever the grind happens.
items.completion_text: You stash it on your desk. Future-you says thanks.

items.name: sticky notes
items.description: A rainbow stack of reminders: "FIX TYPES", "RUN PYTHONT A", "DON'T PANIC".
items.hint: They stick best where mistakes are made.
items.completion_text: You plaster them onto your monitor. The wall of shame grows.

items.name: study timer
items.description: A tiny timer. It makes time feel louder.
items.hint: Time matters most where seconds disappear.
items.completion_text: You reset the timer. This time, you’re ready.

items.name: lecture notes
items.description: Messy lecture notes written under academic duress.
items.hint: They belong beside the code they were meant to help.
items.completion_text: You flip through them once, then stack them neatly.

items.name: clicker
items.description: An old lecture clicker. Still clings to relevance.
items.hint: Some things never really leave where they started.
items.completion_text: You set it down. Attendance taken. Semester remembered.

items.name: camera strap
items.description: A camera strap with a cracked clip.
items.hint: Lost things tend to return to where people gather.
items.completion_text: You leave it where someone might recognize it.

items.name: notebook
items.description: A notebook filled with half-plans and real ideas.
items.hint: Ideas grow where projects are finished.
items.completion_text: You open it to a blank page. It feels earned.

items.name: scarf
items.description: A warm scarf. Confidence multiplier: +3%.
items.hint: Warmth waits where nights are longest.
items.completion_text: You hang it up. The room feels safer already.

items.name: spare usb cable
items.description: A spare USB cable. Underrated hero.
items.hint: Backups belong near the main machine.
items.completion_text: You coil it carefully. Redundancy achieved.

items.name: toonie
items.description: A shiny toonie. It feels like an apology.
items.hint: Warm drinks wait where coffee smells strongest.
items.completion_text: You trade it for caffeine. Fair deal.

items.name: python cheat sheet
items.description: Handwritten syntax and warnings about mutation.
items.hint: The proof wall waits for useful lies.
items.completion_text: You tack it up. The language feels friendlier.

items.name: pencil
items.description: A chewed pencil. Survivor of stress.
items.hint: Writing ends where work begins.
items.completion_text: You toss it onto the desk. It’s seen enough.

items.name: hand sanitizer
items.description: A tiny bottle with weaponized alcohol smell.
items.hint: Clean hands near shared knowledge.
items.completion_text: You leave it by the door. A public service.

items.name: flashcard deck
items.description: A deck of flashcards. Top card: "Big-O".
items.hint: Once the exam is over, they come home.
items.completion_text: You put them away. The threat is neutralized.

items.name: printed report
items.description: A draft marked in red. Judgment incarnate.
items.hint: It belongs beside the code it critiques.
items.completion_text: You line it up with the screen. Final pass begins.

items.name: blue pen
items.description: A pen that smudges instantly.
items.hint: Ink rests where thinking happens.
items.completion_text: You cap it. No more edits—for now.

items.name: coffee
items.description: Cold coffee. Still powerful.
items.hint: Fuel the final stretch.
items.completion_text: You take a sip. Regret. Energy.

items.name: headphones
items.description: Headphones with uneven balance.
items.hint: Silence belongs where focus lives.
items.completion_text: You put them on. The world fades out.

items.name: cookie
items.description: A wrapped cookie. Strategic sugar.
items.hint: Rewards come home.
items.completion_text: You save it. Motivation secured.

items.name: water bottle
items.description: A dented bottle. Still loyal.
items.hint: Hydration is safest at base.
items.completion_text: You refill it. Small win.

items.name: sticker sheet
items.description: Tiny stickers with zero productivity value.
items.hint: Decorations belong where victories are earned.
items.completion_text: You stick one on your laptop. Morale increases.

items.name: spare paper
items.description: Clean pages. Rare commodity.
items.hint: Paper piles up near printers.
items.completion_text: You add it to the stack. Resources secured.

items.name: calculator
items.description: A solar calculator with scars.
items.hint: Math lives where problems are solved.
items.completion_text: You place it down. Numbers behave again.

items.name: lab access form
items.description: A form that demands authority.
items.hint: Sometimes paperwork never really leaves the desk.
items.completion_text: You set it aside. Not today.

items.name: marker
items.description: A squeaky dry-erase marker.
items.hint: Whiteboards wait near ideas.
items.completion_text: You cap it quickly. No more noise.
